source.name: Deleting values
source.instructions:
A `bank` database has been created for you.

`USE` the `bank` database and complete the following tasks using the `mysql` prompt:

1. Delete the records where `user_id` equals 414, from the `u_accounts` table.

---
Once you have completed these tasks press the _Check It!_ button to have your solution assessed.

source.name: Truncating tables
source.instructions:
A `bank` database has been created for you.

`USE` the `bank` database and complete the following tasks using the `mysql` prompt:

1. Truncate the `assets` table.

---
Once you have completed these tasks press the _Check It!_ button to have your solution assessed.

source.name: Deleting table values
source.instructions:
A `RE` (Real Estate) database has been created for you.

`USE` the `RE` database and complete the following tasks using the `mysql` prompt:

1. Delete all the records from the `payments` table where `paid` equals `1`

---
Once you have completed these tasks press the _Check It!_ button to have your solution assessed.

source.name: Deleting columns
source.instructions:
A `bank` database has been created for you.

`USE` the `bank` database and complete the following tasks using the `mysql` prompt:

1. Remove the `cc_num` (credit card number) column from the `u_accounts` table.

---
Once you have completed these tasks press the _Check It!_ button to have your solution assessed.

source.name: Deleting table columns
source.instructions:
`USE` the `RE` database and complete the following tasks using the `mysql` prompt:

1. Remove the `property_id` column from the `clients` table

---
Once you have completed these tasks press the _Check It!_ button to have your solution assessed.

source.name: Deleting all table records
source.instructions:
`USE` the `RE` database and complete the following tasks using the `mysql` prompt:

1. Delete all the records from the `catalog` table but not the table itself

---
Once you have completed these tasks press the _Check It!_ button to have your solution assessed.

source.name: Dropping databases
source.instructions:
A `restaurant` database has been created for you.

Using the `mysql` prompt:

1. Drop the entire `restaurant` database

---
Once you have completed these tasks press the _Check It!_ button to have your solution assessed.

source.name: Omitting WHERE
source.instructions:
`USE` the `bank` database and complete the following tasks using the `mysql` prompt:

---
Once you have completed these tasks press the _Check It!_ button to have your solution assessed.

source.name: Deleting tables
source.instructions:
A `bank` database has been created for you.

`USE` the `bank` database and complete the following tasks using the `mysql` prompt:

Once you have completed these tasks press the _Check It!_ button to have your solution assessed.
